entry.title: The Absolute Best Easter Candy
entry.summary:
Our good friend the Easter Bunny wants to know: Are you counting down the days until Easter? We definitely are! Easter is creeping up fast, and if there’s one thing you don’t want to be unprepared for, it’s that crazy last minute Easter candy shopping.

entry.content:
Our good friend the Easter Bunny wants to know: Are you counting down the days until Easter? We definitely are!

Easter is creeping up fast, and if there’s one thing you don’t want to be unprepared for, it’s that crazy last minute Easter candy shopping. Why go to a busy store and fight over the last bag of pretty pastel-coloured Easter candy when you can order everything you need to please your family and friends (and yourself!) right here online? (We promise we won’t hold it against you if you’re ordering from the couch in your pajamas with a glass of wine. Your secret is safe with us!)

Do you want to know the secret to picking the absolute best Easter candy? It’s really simple: You need variety. Great Easter baskets never contain just one type of candy. From chocolates to hard candies, from sweet to sour, from classic candies to brand spankin’ new ones, picking a variety of Easter candy will make you everyone’s hero.

The best part about shopping online at Candy Funhouse for Easter candy is that our candy connoisseurs have made the job super easy for you. If you need some timely inspiration on what to put in Easter baskets or hide on an Easter egg hunt, read on! We’ve got the low-down on the best Easter candy guaranteed to put smiles on the faces of your loved ones:

The Best Easter Candy to Go in Your Easter Baskets

There are so many delightful candies you can include in your Easter baskets that will be sure to make your kiddos smile with delight. You can’t make a bad choice when it comes to Easter candy!

One of our favourite Easter sweets has to be the Reese’s Miniatures Peanut Butter Filled Chicks. What could be better than a Reese’s peanut butter cup? Lots of mini ones inside a festive yellow chick egg package! Everyone loves the classic peanut butter-chocolate combo that Reese’s is known for, so this Easter special is a no-brainer. You could also try the Reese’s Easter Egg, which is just as cute and delicious.

Another great candy choice for any Easter basket are lollipops, especially the rainbow ones. Not only are these tasty, but they’ll add extra visual appeal to your baskets with a colourful twist! Candy Funhouse has some great lollipop options, including the Easter Curly Swirly Lollipops and the Easter Curly Swirly Egg Lollipops. Festive and bright, they are also shaped like a bunny and an egg, the perfect symbols for springtime.

Of course, no basket could be complete without the Canadian Easter classic— Cadbury Crème Eggs! Their thick chocolate shells hide a delicious surprise—yellow and white fondant that mimics the look of a chicken egg yolk. So good!  

The Best Easter Candy for Your Easter Egg Hunt

An Easter egg hunt is usually the highlight of the day for many families, so why not “wow” your kids with not only your expert egg hiding skills, but also your amazing Easter egg candy selecting skills too?

Of course, the classic Easter candies are Cadbury Mini Eggs, Mini Whoppers Eggs, and Reese’s Pieces Eggs—all great chocolate choices that should make an appearance inside any plastic egg found on your hunt. But like we said before, variety when it comes to Easter candy makes things so much sweeter. So, mix things up on your egg hunt by also including some non-chocolate Easter candies, such as Mike and Ike Easter Treats or Sweetarts Mini Gummy Bites.

Finding candy small enough to put into Easter eggs can be tough, but luckily, you have Candy Funhouse on your side. Our team of fun-gineers recommend using a combination of Laffy Taffys (their chewy sweetness is addicting!), Hershey’s Kisses (the yellow foil ones will make you think you’ve found gold!), and pastel-coloured Salt Water Taffys (with a variety of flavours available, including Bubble Gum,  Blueberry, Laffy Taffy Banana, and even Chocolate Chip Cookie).

The Best Easter Candy to Use On Your Easter Desserts

When your family and friends gather around the dinner table to share an Easter Sunday meal, you can bet they are all wondering what’s in store for dessert. Get creative and surprise your dinner guests with an innovative and unique Easter dessert featuring special Easter candies. You’ll definitely win over the dessert-lovers around the table and make an Instagram-worthy treat at the same time!

Check out some of these desserts that you can make with our Candy Funhouse sweets and treats:

Cadbury Crème Egg Cupcakes

This recipe combines two of your favourite things: Cadbury Crème Mini Eggs and cupcakes! With this dessert, you bake the Cadbury Mini Eggs right into the cupcakes and decorate the top of the cupcakes with them too. What more could you ask for in an Easter dessert?! These cupcakes will be an instant hit with your guests.

No-Bake Chocolate Egg Nest Cookies

These are adorable! If you’re looking for something simple and easy but really tasty to make with your kids over the Easter weekend, these cookies might be the perfect option. This recipe combines chocolate chips and chow mein noodles for a “nest”-inspired base. Then you add your “eggs”—Mini Robin Eggs, Jelly Belly jelly beans, or M&Ms in any of your favourite flavours. These almost look too good to eat!

Easter Candy Kabobs

Combine your favourite Easter candies in a way you’ve never tried before: Easter Candy Kabobs. What could be more fun? This recipe is quick, easy, and kid-friendly. Plus, you can customize your Easter kabobs with any candy that you love, such as Sour Punch Twists, Warheads Chewy Bunnies, and springtime Awesome Blossom gummies. The combinations are nearly endless!

We’ve thrown so many ideas out at you that even the Easter Bunny was frantically taking notes. Trust us when we say that your loved ones are going to love any and all of these candies. So what are you waiting for? Get “cracking” now and order your Easter candy today. You won’t regret it!

In the comments below, let us know what YOUR favourite Easter sweets are. Happy Easter!

entry.title: The Easter Bunny’s Top 9 Easter Candies
entry.summary:
Easter is coming up quickly and you know what that means… lots of sugary goodness left behind by the one and only Easter Bunny!

More
entry.content:
Easter is coming up quickly and you know what that means… lots of sugary goodness left behind by the one and only Easter Bunny!

Halloween might get all the credit for being the top candy holiday, but don’t discount that springtime sweet tooth—Easter is a worthy rival for the most “sweet” day of the year! You could always buy a premade basket for your kids this Easter, but where’s the fun in that?! Get creative and personalize your Easter baskets with candies that you know your kids will love. With so much variety of colourful Easter candy, it won’t be tough at all!

Wondering what your family will love this year? No worries! Our Candy Funhouse fun-gineers teamed up with the Easter Bunny to give you the coveted list of the Top 9 Easter Candies for 2018 (and pssst—we carry all of these, right here online—no need to make a last-minute trip to the crazy-busy store!).

Oreo Mint Cookies

Do you love Peeps? Do you love Oreos? If you said yes to either question, you gotta try Oreo Peeps cookies! These cookies are a limited edition Easter treat that combine the deliciousness of Oreos with rich Peeps-flavoured creme filling. If you thought Double Stuffed Oreos were your favourite, just wait until you try these ones!

Cadbury Mini Eggs

This Canadian candy classic should be a staple on any Easter sweets list! Cadbury Mini Eggs are a crowd pleaser and for good reason—their soft Easter-inspired colours, that crunchy candy-coated shell, the solid milk chocolate core… we’re starting to crave some just thinking about them!

These addicting pastel-coloured miniature eggs were first introduced in 1967 and have only grown in popularity since. Plus, they’ve got the cutest co-stars in their television commercials. Raise your hand if you remember this Cadbury Mini Egg commercial from the ‘80s:

Mini Whoppers Eggs

These Whoppers Eggs may be mini in size but they're huge on taste! The Whoppers Mini Malted Milk Eggs are a sweet addition to any Easter Basket. They have all the unique tastiness and crunchiness of the original Whoppers malt balls, but also come with a fun egg-shaped Easter twist. The Easter Bunny loves these and we’re sure your family will too!

Bonus fact: Did you know Whoppers were first sold unwrapped, two pieces for a single cent? What a steal!

Warheads Chewy Bunnies

The Easter Bunny doesn’t believe that all of your candy has to be sweet. Mix it up in your Easter baskets this year and include something sour!


Most sour candy lovers think Warheads are the sourest candy they’ve ever tried. We’re sure the Warheads Chewy Bunnies are no exception! Do you agree? They have that face-puckering effect, but you be the judge on this one. We dare you!

Reese’s Pieces Eggs

No Easter basket is complete without some sort of peanut butter and chocolate candy. If you want to mix up the flavours in your baskets’ candy loot, Reese’s Pieces Peanut Butter Pastel Eggs are a surefire way to do that while putting a smile on your kids’ faces.


Reese’s Pieces Eggs are one of the Easter Bunny’s favourites because they combine the classic peanut butter chocolate combo with a tasty candy-coated shell that reminds us of springtime and sweetness. Plus, they are always fun searching for in the plastic green “grass “at the bottom of an Easter basket—gotta find every last one of these delicious chocolate eggs!

Mini Robin Eggs 

Have you tried Mini Robin Eggs before? If not, you’re in for a treat. Mini Robin Eggs are similar to the Mini Whoppers Eggs everyone knows and loves, but this special Easter candy is a fan favourite that can’t be left off the list. They come in 4 fun Easter colors – blue, white, yellow, and pink. Plus, they’re individually bespeckled to look closer to the real thing!

Bonus fact: Mini Robin Eggs have been around for a long time. In fact, before they were “mini,” they were Giants. In 1939, Giants were the first malted milk balls produced, but it wasn’t until ten years later that they changed their name to Whoppers.

Mike and Ike Easter Treats Theatre Pack

Now here’s an Easter candy the Easter Bunny highly recommends: Mike and Ike Easter Treats! Mike and Ikes are the fruit-flavoured candies that have a fun name and a great taste! They were first introduced in 1940 by the Just Born company in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania and have been going strong ever since. They added this special Easter edition candy back in the early 2000s, and it was an instant hit!

Bonus fact: The reason behind the candy’s name is a mystery. There are many theories on how the candy got its name, but no one knows for sure.

Reese’s Peanut Butter Egg

If there was ever candy we’re sure that you’ve tried (unless you have a peanut allergy, in which case, we feel for you!), it has to be Reese’s Peanut Butter Eggs. These are the epitome of classic Easter candy and should be must-have item for your Easter treats shopping list. Whether you load them up in your kids’ Easter baskets or hand them out to your coworkers, you’re sure to be everyone’s favourite Easter Bunny!

Reese’s Peanut Butter Eggs take the classic Reese’s Peanut Butter Cup and puts a whole new twist on it with a fun, limited edition egg shape. Is it just us or do these taste a little different—perhaps even better—than the normal Reese’s cups? We’re definitely going to be stocking up on these. How about you?

PEZ Easter White Bunny

This one is a great little addition to your kids’ Easter gifts as it combines both a candy and a toy! PEZ, the famous German candy, has a special edition Easter White Bunny dispenser that you won’t want to miss out on. This adorable dispenser tube resembles the Easter Bunny and comes with plenty of extra little candies inside!

Bonus fact: The word PEZ was created using the first, middle and last letter in the German word for peppermint: PfeffErminZ.


Do you have tons of ideas on how to fill your Easter baskets this year? We hope so! If this list of delicious, Easter-inspired candies doesn’t make your mouth water, we’re not sure what will. Let us know what Easter candy you’ll be delighting your family and friends with this spring in the comments.


Happy Easter!
